FuncDef: The display bgp rpd routing-table peer command displays information about BGP peers in the BGP RPD address family.
CLIs: display bgp rpd routing-table peer <ipv4-address> { advertised-routes | received-routes }

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about the routes advertised to a specified peer.
-

Displays information about the routes received from a specified peer.
-

Displays information about routes of a specified peer.
It is in dotted decimal notation.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display bgp rpd routing-table peer 192.168.1.1 advertised-routes
Status codes: * - valid, > - best, d - damped, x - best external, a - add path,
h - history,  i - internal, s - suppressed, S - Stale
Origin : i - IGP, e - EGP, ? - incomplete
Network                        Peer           MED        LocPrf    PrefVal Path/Ogn
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To check information about desired RPD routes, you can specify parameters as required.
